thread.title: First female to join all male cricket team in 100 years meets her Black Caps idols at the Basin Reserve | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: First female to join all male cricket team in 100 years meets her Black Caps idols at the Basin Reserve | Stuff.co.nz

author: Lucy Swinnen
title: First female to join all male cricket team in 100 years meets her Black Caps idols at the Basin Reserve | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Reefton Hokitika First female to join all male cricket team in 100 years meets her Black Caps idols at the Basin Reserve Lucy Swinnen 19:35, February 23 2017 MAARTEN HOLL/FAIRFAX NZ 
Erin Buckland with Black Caps heroes Tom Latham, left, Tim Southee, Ross Taylor and Mitchell Santner. 
A young cricket star was left lost for words when she met and played cricket with her idols at Wellington's Basin Reserve. 
Erin Buckland, 13, of Levin was supposed to be heading to an orthodontist appointment after school on Thursday, but was instead left in complete "shock" at meeting with four Black Caps players. 
Erin and 16 other girls were picked up after school and driven to the hallowed turf for a surprise training session with Black Caps Tom Latham, Ross Taylor, Mitchell Santner and Tim Southee. MAARTEN HOLL/FAIRFAX NZ 
Erin Buckland works on her training drills at the Basin Reserve. 
Erin was the first female to join the all-male Levin Old Boys Cricket Club team in 100 years and was recognised for her passion by the ANZ Dream Deliveries promotion, which promotes cricket across the country. 
READ MORE: 
"This will be a day she won't ever forget," her mum Nicola Buckland said. Advertisement MAARTEN HOLL/FAIRFAX NZ 
Levin's Erin Buckland is presented a bat from Black Caps Tom Latham, left, Tim Southee, Ross Taylor and Mitchell Santner. 
Erin originally wanted to start cricket about three years ago, Buckland said. 
However "I actually discouraged her, I said let her brother do it. I would like him to do something without you going in and being fantastic at it." 
But once she started "she just took to it naturally and loved it". 
"She could do it every night." 
Buckland helped found an all girls cricket coaching clinic in her region with Central Hinds coach Mikaela Greig and dreams of one day joining the White Ferns. 
Spin bowler Santner was picked out as a favourite by the gaggle of girls gathered at the Basin. 
"Obviously, when I was in school if the Black Caps rocked up I'd be like, what is going on," the Hamilton all-rounder said. 
He said it was great to help see girls' presence growing in the game and "quite cool to interact with them and see their love for the game just like us." 
In addition to the training session, Erin received a kit bag, and a bowling machine and gear bag for the girls' cricket coaching clinic. 
" [Erin] is so clearly an inspiration to the girls in the region, and we hope that by giving her and her teammates a once-in-a-lifetime experience, we will only continue to inspire her to achieve," ANZ head of sponsorship and corporate marketing Sue McGregor said. 
It will be back to school for Erin on Friday, but she will go back with a one in a lifetime experience. 
The Black Caps are in Wellington ahead of their third one-day international match against South Africa at Westpac Stadium on Saturday. Stuff
